bug_report.title: EJB Invocation Failure Due to Component Shutdown

stepsToReproduce: Deploy the application containing the Message Driven Bean (MDB).
Send a message to the queue that the MDB is listening to.
Shut down the application server or the specific EJB component while the message is being processed.
description.actualBehavior: The application throws an EJBComponentUnavailableException indicating that the invocation cannot proceed as the component is shutting down.
description.possibleCause: The MDB is attempting to process a message while the EJB component is in the process of shutting down, leading to an invocation failure.

bug_report.title: NullPointerException in ListIndex.loadNode

stepsToReproduce: 1. Start the ActiveMQ broker with KahaDB as the persistence store.
2. Send a message to a queue using the STOMP protocol.
3. Attempt to retrieve the message from the queue.
description.actualBehavior: The application throws a NullPointerException when trying to load a node in the ListIndex.
description.possibleCause: It is possible that the ListIndex is trying to access a node that has not been initialized or has been corrupted.

bug_report.title: FileNotFoundException during KahaDB transaction processing

stepsToReproduce: 1. Set up the ActiveMQ broker with KahaDB as the message store.
2. Create a test queue named 'testQueueTransactionalOrderWithRestart'.
3. Attempt to perform a transaction that involves writing messages to the queue.
4. Restart the broker while the transaction is in progress.
description.actualBehavior: The application throws a FileNotFoundException indicating that a temporary file in the KahaDB directory could not be found.
description.possibleCause: The temporary file may not have been created due to a failure in the transaction process, or it may have been deleted or moved unexpectedly during the broker restart.

bug_report.title: IOException during message acknowledgment in ActiveMQ

stepsToReproduce: 1. Start the ActiveMQ broker with KahaDB as the message store.
2. Send a message to a queue.
3. Attempt to acknowledge the message from the queue.
description.actualBehavior: An IOException is thrown indicating an input/output error when trying to read from the KahaDB store during message acknowledgment.
description.possibleCause: The issue may be related to file system errors, disk space issues, or corruption in the KahaDB data files.

bug_report.title: ActiveMQ Message Duplication Check Causes Deadlock

stepsToReproduce: 1. Start the ActiveMQ server.
2. Create multiple message producers and consumers.
3. Send a high volume of messages to the queue while simultaneously consuming them.
description.actualBehavior: The application hangs or becomes unresponsive due to a deadlock in the message duplication check process.
description.possibleCause: The issue may be caused by concurrent access to the ActiveMQ message audit structures without proper synchronization, leading to a deadlock situation.

bug_report.title: IllegalArgumentException: Comparison method violates its general contract

stepsToReproduce: 1. Start the ActiveMQ broker with the specified configuration.
2. Send multiple messages to a queue.
3. Attempt to dispatch messages to consumers.
description.actualBehavior: The application throws an IllegalArgumentException indicating that the comparison method violates its general contract during message dispatch.
description.possibleCause: The comparator used for sorting messages may not be consistent with the contract of the compare method, leading to unpredictable behavior during sorting.

bug_report.stackTrace:

bug_report.title: IndexOutOfBoundsException in FailoverTransport during URI update

stepsToReproduce: 1. Start the ActiveMQ server with a configuration that includes multiple URIs.
2. Simulate a failover scenario by disconnecting one of the URIs.
3. Observe the logs or console output for any exceptions thrown.
description.actualBehavior: An IOException is thrown with an underlying IndexOutOfBoundsException indicating an attempt to access an index that is out of bounds.
description.possibleCause: The FailoverTransport may be trying to add a new URI to a list that has not been properly initialized or has been modified unexpectedly, leading to an index that exceeds the current size of the list.
